EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position: 0.0, 0.0)  
  Acts as the core processing facility for smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Iron Chest (position: 1.5, 0.5)  
  Placed adjacent to the furnace to store the produced iron plates.

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (-16.0, -51.0)
Consists of:
- Burner Mining Drill (position: -16.0, -51.0)  
  Set up for automated iron ore extraction with a designated drop position at (-15.5, -49.5).
- Transport Belt (position: -15.5, -49.5)  
  Installed at the drill’s drop position (facing RIGHT) to convey extracted ore.
- Output Inserter (position: -14.5, -49.5)  
  Configured with a pickup position at (-15.5, -49.5) and a drop position at (-13.5, -49.5) to transfer items from the transport belt.
- Output Chest (position: -13.5, -49.5)  
  Repositioned adjacent to the output inserter to collect items from the inserter.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Placement Collision Errors  
  – Ensure the target tile for placing entities (especially burner inserters) is clear of other objects. Adjust spacing, direction, or reference positions to avoid collisions.

• Belt Connection Errors  
  – Validate alignment and connectivity when linking transport belts to inserters. Use the proper intermediary (inserter) when connecting to storage (chest) to maintain a valid connection path.

• Undefined Entity Reference  
  – Confirm that all entity variables are correctly assigned and defined before they are referenced in connection operations.

• Inventory Availability Checks  
  – Verify that required items (for example, burner-inserter) are present in the inventory prior to attempting placement to avoid missing item errors.

• Fuel Management  
  – Monitor and maintain fuel levels for automated entities like mining drills to prevent operation disruptions.

• Harvesting Proximity Error  
  – Move the agent within immediate reach of a resource patch before initiating harvesting commands.

• Inventory Verification for Placement  
  – Ensure the required entity is present in the inventory before placing it.

• Ingredient Dependency for Composite Crafting  
  – Confirm that all necessary sub-ingredients are available before crafting composite items.

• Placement Range Error  
  – Position the agent close enough to the target location to satisfy placement range requirements.

• Output Sink Blockage  
  – Arrange sink entities (such as chests) correctly within the drill’s drop zone to prevent output blockage.
